001.comments: The upper-level undergraduate seminar MUSC 430I (001) Major Composer: Mozart will introduce the standard and recent scholarly musicological studies on Mozarts music and his world. Topics include Mozart in Vienna, Haydns impact on Mozarts string quartets, Mozarts concerto and aria type, Mozart and the opera seria convention, Mozarts Le Nozze di Figaro, sociability in Mozarts instrumental music, Mozarts Requiem and social justice, Mozart and modernist esthetics, Mozarts wit, the beauty of Mozarts music and aspects of human significance (e.g., melancholy). This course is synchronous, but students who live in different time zones will have access to recorded sessions. Students are to participate actively in discussions, present readings, and complete weekly assignments. Mid-term a and ~nd final exams will be take-home essay exams. Each student is to complete a research paper on Mozarts music or aspects of his life. Students who have special needs or requests should contact me (hedy.law@ubc.ca) by the first week of class.

description: The musical works of no more than two significant composers will be examined. Specific topics will be announced; may be repeated for credit.
